member.name: T:Fusee.Math.ArrayConvert
member.summary: Contains functions to convert number Arrays to\from Fusee.Math structures.

member.name: M:Fusee.Math.ArrayConvert.float4x4ToArrayFloatRowOrder(Fusee.Math.float4x4)
member.summary: Converts a to an Array of floats. The row major order storage of the original matrix is kept. This way the returned array can be used in environments taking row major order matrices (e.g. OpenGL). Use ToArray[]ColOrder for converting the original matrix to environments taking column major order matrices (like e.g. DirectX).
member.returns: A float array containing 16 values in row major order [m11, m12, m13, ...].

member.name: M:Fusee.Math.ArrayConvert.float4x4ToArrayFloatColOrder(Fusee.Math.float4x4)
member.summary: Converts a to an Array of floats. The row major order storage of the original matrix is converted to column major order (the matrix is transposed before exporting it to an Array). This way the returned array can be used in environments taking column major order matrices (like e.g. DirectX). Use ToArray[]RowOrder for converting the original matrix to environments taking row major order matrices (e.g. OpenGL).
member.returns: A float array containing 16 values in column major order [m11, m21, m31, ...].

member.name: M:Fusee.Math.ArrayConvert.float4x4ToArrayDoubleRowOrder(Fusee.Math.float4x4)
member.summary: Converts a to an Array of doubles. The row major order storage of the original matrix is kept. This way the returned array can be used in environments taking row major order matrices (e.g. OpenGL). Use ToArray[]ColOrder for converting the original matrix to environments taking column major order matrices (like e.g. DirectX).
member.returns: A double array containing 16 values in row major order [m11, m12, m13, ...].

member.name: M:Fusee.Math.ArrayConvert.float4x4ToArrayDoubleColOrder(Fusee.Math.float4x4)
member.summary: Converts a to an Array of double values. The row major order storage of the original matrix is converted to column major order (the matrix is transposed before exporting it to an Array). This way the returned array can be used in environments taking column major order matrices (like e.g. DirectX). Use ToArray[]RowOrder for converting the original matrix to environments taking row major order matrices (e.g. OpenGL).
member.returns: A double array containing 16 values in column major order [m11, m21, m31, ...].

member.summary: Converts a to an Array of floats. The row major order storage of the original matrix is kept. This way the returned array can be used in environments taking row major order matrices (e.g. OpenGL). Use ToArray[]ColOrder for converting the original matrix to environments taking column major order matrices (like e.g. DirectX).
member.returns: A float array containing 16 values in row major order [m11, m12, m13, ...].

member.name: M:Fusee.Math.ArrayConvert.double4x4ToArrayFloatColOrder(Fusee.Math.double4x4)
member.summary: Converts a to an Array of floats. The row major order storage of the original matrix is converted to column major order (the matrix is transposed before exporting it to an Array). This way the returned array can be used in environments taking column major order matrices (like e.g. DirectX). Use ToArray[]RowOrder for converting the original matrix to environments taking row major order matrices (e.g. OpenGL).
member.returns: A float array containing 16 values in column major order [m11, m21, m31, ...].

member.summary: Converts a to an Array of doubles. The row major order storage of the original matrix is kept. This way the returned array can be used in environments taking row major order matrices (e.g. OpenGL). Use ToArray[]ColOrder for converting the original matrix to environments taking column major order matrices (like e.g. DirectX).
member.returns: A double array containing 16 values in row major order [m11, m12, m13, ...].

member.name: M:Fusee.Math.ArrayConvert.double4x4ToArrayDoubleColOrder(Fusee.Math.double4x4)
member.summary: Converts a to an Array of double values. The row major order storage of the original matrix is converted to column major order (the matrix is transposed before exporting it to an Array). This way the returned array can be used in environments taking column major order matrices (like e.g. DirectX). Use ToArray[]RowOrder for converting the original matrix to environments taking row major order matrices (e.g. OpenGL).
member.returns: A double array containing 16 values in column major order [m11, m21, m31, ...].

member.name: M:Fusee.Math.ArrayConvert.double4x4ToArrayDoubleC4DLayout(Fusee.Math.double4x4)
member.summary: Converts a to an Array of double values in the somewhat awkward Cinema 4D Matrix layout. This is a 3 rows, 4 columns matrix stored as column vectors with the "offset" vector first (although internally the C4D Matrix arithmetics is rather row major order oriented). Anyway, the layout of the resulting array will be [m14, m24, m34, m11, m21, m31, m12, m22, m32, m13, m23, m33]. The "projection part" of the original 4x4 matrix is ignored.
member.returns: A double array containing 12 double values in the Cinema 4D matrix layout described above.

member.name: M:Fusee.Math.ArrayConvert.double4x4ToArrayDoubleC4DLayout(Fusee.Math.double4x4,System.Double*)
member.summary: Copys a to an existing array of double values in the somewhat awkward Cinema 4D Matrix layout. This is a 3 rows, 4 columns matrix stored as column vectors with the "offset" vector first (although internally the C4D Matrix arithmetics is rather row major order oriented). Anyway, the layout of the resulting array will be [m14, m24, m34, m11, m21, m31, m12, m22, m32, m13, m23, m33]. The "projection part" of the original 4x4 matrix is ignored.
member.param: The destination pointer to write the matrix values to.
member.returns: A double array containing 12 double values in the Cinema 4D matrix layout described above.

member.name: M:Fusee.Math.ArrayConvert.ArrayDoubleC4DLayoutTodouble4x4(System.Double*)
member.summary: Creates a new from an Array of twelve double values in the somewhat awkward Cinema 4D Matrix layout. This is a 3 rows, 4 columns matrix stored as column vectors with the "offset" vector first (although internally the C4D Matrix arithmetics is rather row major order oriented). Anyway, the layout of the parameter array is expected as follows [m14, m24, m34, m11, m21, m31, m12, m22, m32, m13, m23, m33]. The "projection part" of the resulting 4x4 matrix (the lower row) is always set to [0, 0, 02.
member.param: An array containing 12 double values in the Cinema 4D matrix layout described above.
member.returns: A newly created object

member.name: M:Fusee.Math.ArrayConvert.float3ToArrayFloat(Fusee.Math.float3)
member.summary: Converts a to a float array.
member.returns: A float array containing three values [x, y, z]
